string-array.name: dadweek
string-array.item:
This week begins with the last days of my Mom‘s menstrual period. I am nowhere on the scene. But you know I am in the thoughts of God. Let me start my story from here. Let me dedicate this week to Mom and call it Mom‘s week. Are you with me Dad?


Are you listening Dad?

Even before we start our journey together let me warn you about my likes and dislikes. I like plenty of fruits and vegetables and I dislike smoking and alcohol. Tell this to everyone at home.

I like simple exercises like going for long walks. Take mom for short walks Daddy. Well for time being let me keep my big mouth shut. I don‘t know you; you don‘t know me either. Hey dad, are you planning something? I can see it on your face. Wait you‘ll have a lot to do. I assure you.


click here for prayer for the week

It is the second week and I am still in the thoughts of God.


Are you listening Dad?

Mom’s uterus is preparing a lush new bed of blood – rich tissue for me. One of the ripened eggs is getting ready to be released. Oops! I have started using medical terms. Hope they are not too difficult for you to understand.

God has a plan for my life. He is sending me to you with a purpose. Yes Dad, my life is purpose driven. I am not an accident. Towards the end of this week, provided mom has a regular cycle, I‘ll need a little cooperation from you too. Ooo… I‘m so excited! A week more and I‘ll be there. Daddy in a while you would be getting another promotion as I enter the scene.


click here for prayer for the week

The real drama begins now. Dad sent many sperms inside mom, but only one intrepid one, the fastest of all swimmers that were vying for that single egg of mom‘s … yes only one could penetrate its outer layer and has fertilized it. God has enabled the first step of my journey. Whatever physical or mental shape I am going to acquire tomorrow will be credited to you both Dad and mom. But you Dad will wholly determine my sex. Mom has nothing to do with it.


Are you listening Dad?

Congratulations on your small step towards making a great Human – it’s me! You are not going to be alone any more.bI am going to bring about a lot of changes in Mom physically and emotionally. Make sure you handle her well. Are you ready for the journey?


click here for prayer for the week

The Blastocyst reaches the uterus and searches for a spot to settle down. Some call it the sprout bag. I call it my first home. The cells in the Blastocyst have begun to divide into two groups – those that form the placenta and those that form ―me. I measure only 0.1-0.2 mm in diameter.


Are you listening Dad?

In case Mom is expecting herr periods let me tell you, she will not get it. She is pregnant now. She might feel restless, fatigue and have mood swings. Support her Dad things will shortly change for the better.

Is Mom kind of peculiar these days? Well it‘s partly my doing. I will take the blame for it. But you played your role too. So be kind to her – try to understand the responsibility she has to bear these days. She has to take care of not only you but me as well.


click here for prayer for the week

Oh Boy I am changing fat these days. I can hardly recognize myself. The developing ―me has three layers now. The top layer (ectoderm will be my nervous system i.e. the brain and spinal chord. The middle layer (mesoderm) will develop into the heart and circulatory system. For the development of intestines, liver, pancreas and bladder it is the lower layer or the endoderm that helps.


Are you listening Dad?

I know Mom‘s mood swings are continuing. Is she throwing temper tantrums too? Well, well, that‘s only the beginning! As I grow with each passing day, she also keeps changing. Be a little patient Dad and I am sure Mom will appreciate that later.


click here for prayer for the week

What‘s that funny faint sound? Oh my! It‘s actually coming from inside me – ‗ lub – dub – lub – dub‘. Bless my heart – they are my first heartbeats. Well, about time too – do you know how big I am now? I am about 1/17th of an inch (0.2 cm) my eyes and ears and a little opening in the mouth as well.


Are you listening Dad?

Mom is going through a little more of nausea and morning sickness. A craving for certain foods is becoming more irresistible to her.

You‘ll have to help mom maintain a healthy diet. Keep her away from certain smells that make her uneasy and be a friend who cares. Easier said than done, I know.


click here for prayer for the week

I am nearly the size of a grain of rice. Do I see a small smile on your face? No jokes – I am growing fast! My arms and legs can now be seen. My brain is growing too, getting bigger with each passing day. It’s boom time for the eyes, nostrils, intestines and pancreas as well.


Are you listening Dad?

Mom has started to put on weight. Let her not feel bad about it. It’s not just her but me too.

I can see you are not doing too badly now. I even heard you tell your friend the other day about me. Great! I kind of like you already!


click here for prayer for the week

Hey, do you know what I got this week? I got my elbows and my fingers. You think that‘s all? No, no, I‘ve got ears, eyes, teeth buds and the tip of the nose as well. What do you think of that now?


Are you listening Dad?

I know Mom is worried about her looks – for those pimples and other skin problems she is getting. Make her understand that they are happening due to an increase in oil secretions.

I like the way you accompany mom everywhere these days. I like it, believe me, especially when the three of us go to the doctor.


click here for prayer for the week

I am around 3.1 cm by now, nearly the size of an olive. Something new is happening within me everyday. I can actually feel it in my bones and cartilage. I am beginning to get eyes and a small little tongue. The intestines are coming out of the umbilical cord and getting into my abdomen. That almost tickles me you know! The fingers and thumbs have appeared but are too tiny. I wish I could grow faster. This is taking a bit too long for my liking!


Are you listening Dad?

My home, Mom’s uterus has become the size of a grape fruit now. She gets some heartburn and indigestion trying to adjust to the pregnancy hormones. Ask Mom to take a little rest; that makes me feel really good.

Is morning sickness becoming more common than the morning tea? Cool it dad, after all you have to take the bad with the good. Mom is looking pretty isn‘t she?


click here for prayer for the week

I am about 4.6 cm by now and weigh around 5 gms. The joints guiding my internal movements are almost formed. And I have started moving inside my home. Shh. don‘t tell mom, she doesn‘t know that yet.


Are you listening Dad?

The occasional dizziness accompanied by those headaches – are getting her down. Blame it all on those wild hormones.

Veins are appearing on her tummy, breasts and the legs. I can see them. Don‘t let that bother her. As the blood volume inside you increases, they develop.

Dad, what are you thinking? One moment I see you staring quizzically at mom – your eyebrows all knitted, shoulders hooked and the next moment I see the little smile on the corner of your mouth. I know – you‘ve begun to get a feel of ensuing fatherhood


click here for prayer for the week

I am around 6 cm by now and weigh around 8 gms. By now I have got all the characteristics of a fetus. The most critical part of my development is over. The placenta has started to develop and blood has started to circulate between my mom‘s uterus and me.


Are you listening Dad?

I bet you Mom is feeling slightly better this week. Although certain smells still bother her, the nausea has subsided a bit and her appetite is increased. I know it because I wasn‘t hungry this week. Her uterus can be felt in her lower abdomen.

Now that mom is feeling better, why don‘t we all go on a short trip? That way you can take a break too. Mind you no rash driving. It might affect me in some way.


click here for prayer for the week

I am around 6.3 cm by now and I weigh around 8 to 14 Gms. Hey want some good news? I can pee now! Nearly all my organs are formed now. Fingers and toes have separated and hair and nails have begun to grow. Gosh – my gender is no more a secret!


Are you listening Dad?

There‘s good news for Mom. The uterus is shifting forward as it grows, but it won‘t press on her bladder much. So those bathroom visits will get less frequent. That‘s good news isn‘t it? Morning sickness is also better. But she is going to gain weight in her hips and legs. I know the headaches are bothering her now.

Do you want to hear my heartbeats? You can use a Doppler for that. Ask the doctor next time you take mom there.


click here for prayer for the week

I am around 7.4 cm by now and I weigh around 23 gms. My eyes and ears are continuing to develop. My neck is getting longer! I can see the room I am staying in.


Are you listening Dad?

Hey Dad Mom should start taking vitamins along with a healthy diet. Do you know something? I only get vitamins from what she eats. I know you are so excited to hear about this. Daddy get nutritious food that would help Mom to increase her nutritional values. Tell her that it’s for me! Ha ha ha..

Getting ready to go for shopping? Give me some more time. I‘ll be right there with you for a jolly go ride.


click here for prayer for the week

I am around 8.7 cm by now and I weigh around 43 Gms Oops I have doubled my weight. I think you are doing great job together in taking care of me. My bones are getting harder and stronger. My skin is still transparent and it really bothers me so much. Very fine hair is covering my body. This will shed only prior to my birth. It helps me to protect my skin.


Are you listening Dad?

Mom might have some discomfort because of this growth in my body. Just few more weeks to go. You know something? If Mom is more than 35 years old, the Doctors will test her for Down‘s syndrome. Cool!! God is in control. Don’t have negative thoughts. Everything is going to be fine when God is with us.

You are doing a great job as father. I can see how you are cooperating with mom. You have stopped seeing at mom as just mom but as me and mom! That‘s great! Do you know how much that excites me? I am so happy for you both.


click here for prayer for the week

" I am around 10.1 cm by now and I weigh around 70 Gms. I have started to move around. Mom can feel my presence every now and then. The three tiny bones in my ears have begun to harden. My eyebrows are beginning to grow. I am becoming beautiful as I always am.


Are you listening Dad?

Moms heart is increasing its output to supply me with oxygen. Her heart is pumping about 20% more blood than pre - pregnancy. This volume would increase throughout her pregnancy for an ending increased heart output of 30-50%. If her clothes are getting tight, get her maternity clothes. Remember I am growing!! Which means its ok for mom to grow.

If mom is raiding your closet for clothes, you are not alone. However, there are products out there that you can try to help her extend the life of her pre-pregnancy clothes that don't involve pins, rubber bands or stealing your clothes!


click here for prayer for the week
"

" I am around 11.6 cm by now and I weigh around 100 Gms. This is a week of ―mights. Mom might hear the tiny thumps of my heart with an external monitor now. The genitals are developed sufficiently that an experienced sonographer might be able to determine if I am a boy or a girl. Be it a boy or a girl you are going to love me isn’t it?


Are you listening Dad?

Mom might begin to feel my movement around this point. This is more likely to happen now if you already had a child before me or if Mom is very thin.These first movements are called ―quickening. They can also be used in helping to determine Mom’s due date. I am not going to stay still anymore.

Have you been to a prenatal appointment recently? It might be nice to try to go again; it's been about a month since you've first heard my heart beat. Think of it as a nice chance to sneak away for lunch together and to celebrate me.


click here for prayer for the week
"

I am around 13 cm by now and I weigh around 140 Gms. I now have much more human appearance. My body limbs are larger in proportion to my head. Oops Meconium (digestive secretion and swallowed amniotic fluid) has started to gather.

Umbilical cord is getting stronger. My skeleton is transforming from cartilage to bone. The bone still remains flexible to make the journey through the birth canal easier.


Are you listening Dad?

Mom’s secretions all over your body may increase, due to the increased blood volume. Sweating more, have nasal congestion, or suffering from increased vaginal discharge tor few symptoms Mom will have. Help her during these discomforts Daddy.

Do you know if there are any expectant dad classes in your area? You might try calling the hospital, birth centre or local childbirth educators to find out if you could be educated on this. Hope this book helps you Dad!


click here for prayer for the week

" I am around 14.2 cm by now and I weigh around 190 Gms. Vernix (a white cheese – like protective material) is forming on my skin to protect my skin during the months in water. See how creative my shepherd is! Tiny air sacs have begun to form in my lungs. I will be putting my lungs to good use in just a few months. I can go through a motion of crying but without air I cannot make sound. Fast growth this week which means tired week for Mom!


Are you listening Dad?

Do not forget to give Mom prenatal vitamins! Sleeping may be increasingly difficult now, as her body grows. Try supporting by buying her maternity pillows. If you haven't started yet, try playing around with baby names. Look through your family history, read books, look at combinations for girls and boys. And if you have a promise from God name me in faith.

Don‘t tell mom that she is trying to look fat. She is looking cute with me right. It‘s not mom alone now but both of us together.


click here for prayer for the week
"

" I am around 15.3 cm by now and I weigh around 240 Gms. I now have the same awake and sleep patterns of a new born. I have a favourite position for sleep and recognizable active and rest periods. Mom would be able to find it out. Milk teeth buds have already developed and over the next few days buds for the permanent teeth will begin to form behind it. In case I am a girl, my uterus starts to develop this week. If I am a boy the genitals are now distinct and recognizable. You know something? I am swallowing amniotic fluid and my kidneys are making urine.


Are you listening Dad?

If you have not looked into childbirth classes now is the time to do so. Child birth education is a great way of informing yourself about pregnancy, labor and birth. There are many different types of classes available and many different types of teachers. Find a class that best fits her schedule. Some classes meet for a few hours every week for several weeks, while other meet for an intense period of time over one or two days.

Mom may start asking you if you feel me move. Invariably you either can't feel me yet or I quit moving as soon as you put your hand on me. This is very normal. Most people can't feel the baby move from the outside until around week 28.


click here for prayer for the week
"

" I am around 16.4 cm by now and I weigh around 300 Gms. I am half way there. The rapid growth stage is over. Even though things have slowed down, this next stage is vital to survival. The nerve cells for taste, smell, hearing, seeing and touch are now developing in specialized areas of the brain. I can actually hear noises outside the womb. If I am a girl I now have approximately six million eggs in my ovaries and about one million would remain at birth. My creator is very creative.


Are you listening Dad?

Help her find a quiet place so that she can lay flat on her back. Locate her heart beat by finding her pulse. Next lay your hand on her belly. You would be able to distinguish between my heart beat and Mom’s. As muscles are developing she would be able to feel my kicks even stronger. I can listen to sounds. Familiar voices, music and sounds that I become accustomed to during developmental stages often are calming at birth. Watch out for what you hear.

Take mom out to dinner to celebrate the half-way point in pregnancy. A gift for the baby is also a nice touch. This is particularly true if you're just finding out if I am a girl or a boy.


click here for prayer for the week
"

I am around 26.7 cm by now and I weigh around 360 Gms. White blood cells are under production in my body. They help in fighting infections and diseases. My skin has become more opaque. My tongue is fully formed. I am swallowing amniotic fluid. I am putting myself into digestion practice.


Are you listening Dad?

Everyone is probably telling you what sex your baby is using different myths! Some people find this fun, others find it annoying. Using things like how you carry, what you eat, the Chinese Gender Chart, or other myths are fun, but not always accurate. Have you decided whether you want to find out the gender of your baby? There are many things to consider before doing so, and still I may not cooperate.

Don’t be worried about my gender Dad. It was decided by your contribution and don’t ever forget it. Be it a boy or a girl I am going to be the apple of your eye. Yes Dad we are soon going to spend time together as I emerge out of my first home!


click here for prayer for the week

I am around 27.8 cm by now and I weigh around 430 Gms. I can now hear your conversations more clearly than before. When you talk, read or sing remember I am hearing you. My eye lids and eye brows are fully formed. Finger nails have grown.

My brain has entered a stage of rapid growth. Why don’t you keep singing His praises to me? My heart would rejoice to do that Mom.


Are you listening Dad?

Mom is still looking pretty good and active in this second trimester. Appreciate her Dad. If she is still having aches and pains or feel like she is slowing down you should look into some different remedies for the problems she is experiencing. With God’s strength she can do it well Dad. It’s time to pray with her now.

Have you packed on a few pounds since the beginning of pregnancy? If so you are not alone. Many dads do put on some weight along with mom. You might also experience other symptoms of pregnancy. Be cool Daddy after all it’s a part of receiving me into your life.


click here for prayer for the week

" I am around 28.9 cm by now and I weigh around 501 Gms. I almost look like a new born but I am thinner. I am able to hear. My eyes are formed. I have begun producing Insulin, important for breakdown of sugars.


Are you listening Dad?

Mom might begin to feel my movement around this point. This is more likely to happen now if you already had a child before me or if she are very thin.

It is not uncommon for first time mothers to not recognize fetal movements until 22-24 weeks. These first movements are called ―quickening. They can also be used in helping to determine the due date. I am not going to stay still anymore.

Mom may actually feel Braxton kick contradictions, or she might just happen to notice with her hand a slight tensing of her abdomen. This is just her uterine muscle preparing for birth. The uterus actually contracts at all phases of a woman's life, however, we rarely notice this unless our uterus is full! Be with mom during these days. It would be a great comfort!


click here for prayer for the week
"

I am around 30 cm by now and I weigh around 600 Gms almost a length of a ruler. My body begins to fill out with my appearance more like a new born. My taste buds are beginning to form. Over the next seven days sweat gland will be forming in the skin. This week I am officially considered viable.


Are you listening Dad?

Mom is now aware of my movements and she might even be able to tell my sleep/wake cycles. It is important to recognize the signs of premature labour. Premature labour is actually more common in the summer months, thought to be caused by dehydration in some women, so ask Mom to continue drinking lots of water!

Mom is now visibly pregnant for most everyone to notice. You may feel a swell of pride when talking about her and the new baby. This is a normal feeling.

And Dad everybody is now asking you about my arrival soon right? Be proud of your God given blessing.


click here for prayer for the week

" I am around 34.6 cm by now and I weigh around 660 Gms. Structures of my spine have begun to form. Blood vessels of the lungs are developing. My nostrils have begun to open. My swallowing reflexes are developing. I can now make a fist and can clasp objects placed in my palm. I am excited I am learning to do new things.


Are you listening Dad?

At this point in pregnancy mom might probably still feel really good! Soon you will begin to see your practitioner more often. When this happens, many women begin to get the feeling that they are running out of time.

Fixing my room or deciding where I sleep, is one of the things you need to work out together now.

If you have opinions about things that relate to baby - speak up! Sometimes mom has a tendency to just give her opinion. Maybe she's asked and you've clammed up? Don't bother, just share what your opinion is on raising baby.


click here for prayer for the week
"

I am around 35.6 cm by now and I weigh around 760 Gms. Air sacs in my lungs are forming now. My eyes are opening and beginning to blink this week. Retinas begin to form. My brain wave activity for hearing and sight begins to be detectable.

If you shine a light on your abdomen mom, I will turn my head, which means my optic nerve is working.


Are you listening Dad?

While Mom has been feeling movements for a while, Dad you may not have been able to. Around this time it may become possible for you to begin feeling me from the outside. It is really nice to share the experience together right?

Finding a comfortable position for sleeping is a new task for Mom! A body pillow will enable her to support her legs and her growing belly! If she doesn’t have one, try to get her one. Some dads choose to sleep elsewhere to avoid disturbances to their sleep, including the many trips to the bathroom Mom makes each night. This should be discussed together.


click here for prayer for the week

I am around 36.6 cm by now and I weigh around 875 Gms. My brain continues its rapid growth. My hearing continues to develop. I have started to recognize your voice and Mom‘s Dad! That‘s interesting right? My lungs are continuing to grow and prepare for functioning outside of the womb. I am continuing to take small breaths. My eye lids are now open more. This week alone I will grow over 1 inch. Oops I am faster now!


Are you listening Dad?

Dad you can now share music, conversation and even books with me. Welcome Mom to the third trimester. The home stretch! Around this time mom will begin to really put on the weight, this will last until about week thirty-six. Although some cultures dictate otherwise, weight gained during pregnancy is not fat or unhealthy, but rather, necessary for a healthy pregnancy and baby.

The weight that she gains will be distributed in several places. If mom is starting to complain about her weight remind her of the importance of weight gain in pregnancy for a health pregnancy. You should also help her by not tempting her with sweets and setting a good example yourself.


click here for prayer for the week

" I am around 37.6 cm by now and I weigh around 1 Kg. My eye brows and eye lashes are now very noticeable. Hair on my head is growing longer. Some babies are born with almost none at all, while others appear to be ready for their first hair cut. My eyes are completely formed now. My body is getting plump and rounded. Lungs are capable of breathing now.


Are you listening Dad?

You can talk to me often, read stories, and sing songs and so on. I can recognize your voice now and will often calm to it later on. Keep talking to me. I really love that.

Have you been to a prenatal appointment recently? It might be nice to try to go again; it's been about a month since you've first heard my heart beat. Think of it as a nice chance to sneak away for lunch together and to celebrate me.


click here for prayer for the week
"

I am around 38.6 cm by now and I weigh around 1153 Gms. My head is in proportion with my body now. Fat continues to accumulate under my skin. My brain can control primitive breathing and body temperatures. My eyes can move in their sockets. I am increasingly sensitive to changes in light, sound, taste and smell! I am now moving from side to side.


Are you listening Dad?

As I have started to move sometimes mom might even wonder thinking that I am performing somersaults for a circus act. As your baby is growing, so is your body. She might feel as if her internal organs are crowded. They are.
The best way to deal with the ―discomforts of pregnancy is
• Good Posture
• Proper Nutrition
• Exercise
• Rest (When she could!)
Most discomforts will occur in her back, her legs, and the amount of air she can take into her lungs. Hang in there!
Have you rubbed her back? You might even consider a professional pregnancy massage. It makes a great gift.


click here for prayer for the week

" I am around 39.9 cm by now and I weigh around 1319 Gms. My head is getting larger to accommodate a period of rapid brain growth. As I grow and fill Mom’s uterus, the amount of amniotic fluid will decrease. Mom won‘t feel lighter any more. I spend more time practicing opening and closing my eye lids. My toe nails are entering into final growth stage. Bone marrow is now producing red blood cells. I now have the capacity to produce tears – within the womb.


Are you listening Dad?

Mom’s posture is still very important to her comfort. Maintaining a good posture is a good way to decrease the strain on her body as her centre of gravity continues to change. One of the things that she can do to help maintain her energy levels and to increase her stamina for the birth is to exercise.

Try taking Mom for walks or swimming short distances. Getting out and stretching will help her feel better and reduce the numbers of pregnancy related complaints.

Take notes in childbirth class. Write down what you think is most important for you to remember. Don't suffer from information overload.


click here for prayer for the week
"

" I am around 41.1 cm by now and I weigh around 1502 Gms. The rate of my physical growth slows down. Even though I don‘t grow much longer, my weight keeps increasing. Fat continues to accumulate. Calcium, Phosphorus and iron being stored in my body and my bones are growing and hardening. My brain has entered another period of rapid growth, producing hundreds of billions of nerve cells! Amazing! I may move to the rhythm of music. Lungs are the only major organs left to complete development.


Are you listening Dad?

Mom’s abdomen swells and her rib cage and pelvis may be sore as I get bigger and fill up all the space she has available. While it is really great that I am gaining weight and growing strong, mom might be in line for different discomforts at this stage of the game, like heart burn and leg cramps

A few women will breeze by even this phase of pregnancy without any discomforts. This does not mean that your body isn't preparing for birth. It could be pain tolerance levels, exercise and agility levels and many other factors. So, count your blessings if Mom falls into this category!

Don't forget to plan for traffic, special parades, having gas and even car keys.


click here for prayer for the week
"

I am around 42.4 cm by now and I weigh around 1702 Gms. All my senses (all the 5) are now working. I am fascinated and practicing testing these out as much as possible. Hair on my head continues to grow in.


Are you listening Dad?

I want to address the last question specifically. About 10% of women will tell you that labour is extremely painful, while 10% of the women will tell you that they experienced no pain. The rest, 80%, will fall someplace in the middle of the two extremes.

But don‘t worry Dad, ―God is with mom as a mighty terrible one. She can cross this valley happily with God’s grace. Just be with her in prayers.

Are you waiting to see whose type of hair I would be having during my birth? Just wait for some more time. Are you ready for baby? What do you have left to do? Sit down and make a list of things that are left to be done before the birth. Do you have a car seat? Have you picked a paediatrician?


click here for prayer for the week

" I am around 43.7 cm by now and I weigh around 1918 Gms. My head size has increased 3/8ths of an inch due to rapid brain growth. Neurons and synapses are developing in huge numbers – forming connections in my brain will give me the skills I need to thrive as a new born. This week I may be able to coordinate sucking and swallowing with breathing. My skull is quite pliable and not completely joined.


Are you listening Dad?

Mom can now probably distinguish my knee from and elbow, even though the movements are smaller. Mom might also notice small bumps that appear to be rhythmic in her uterus. This is probably caused by me having hiccoughs and isn't cause for alarm

Don't forget to spend some time practicing relaxation with mom. Try putting on some nice, quiet music and giving her a massage and working on practicing relaxation for birth.


click here for prayer for the week
"

" I am around 45cm by now and I weigh around 2146 Gms. I almost behave like a new born now my eyes opened when I am awake and closed when sleeping. I am settled with a regular sleeping time now. I have learned to blink. I have already turned to a head down position in preparation for birth. Finger nails have reached the end of the finger tips.


Are you listening Dad?

Do you know something? I can see more clearly when there is a bright light on Mom’s stomach and probably I have the outline of all her organs memorized. Antibodies from her blood are being transferred to me. This bond between us continues till birth. Mom’s body is really getting ready and she might notice that she has more and more contractions that seem less and less like practice! This is a great sign that her body is getting ready!
Labour is broken down into three stages:
• First stage - contractions that open the cervix.
• Second stage - pushing the baby out.
• Third stage - birthing the placenta
If you haven't done it yet, consider doing a piece of art work that is related to your pregnancy. You can do a photo shoot, paint her belly. It's a great way to spend time together as well as commemorate the pregnancy.


click here for prayer for the week
"

" I am around 46.2 cm by now and I weigh around 2383 Gms. Most babies born now will survive and without any long term problems. Fat accumulations plumps up my arms and legs this week. . These layers of fat help me to regulate my body temperature. They also provide that cute little dimple on elbows and knees. My hearing is fully developed. I am now taking up most of the uterus.


Are you listening Dad?

Mom might even feel like her chest has run short of room. Soon enough though, I will move down and she will be able to breathe easily. Her pregnancy is progressing and she might have trouble sleeping at night. There are numerous physical reasons that sleep may be difficult.

For one going to the bathroom every 45 minutes isn't conducive to sleep, nor is a constant back ache.

If you haven't enjoyed playing the kicking game with me, do so now.

Typically when you hold your hand on mom's belly you'll feel the baby kick. Try tapping back and see how I respond.


click here for prayer for the week
"

I am around 47.4 cm by now and I weigh around 2622 Gms. The only organ still to mature is the lungs. Each day the baby stays within the womb, it will multiply its chances to breathe on its own. This week I may drop into the birth canal. Skin is growing smooth; call it ―baby soft. I have fully developed pair of kidneys.


Are you listening Dad?

While breathing for mom becomes easier walking may be the exact opposite. Most babies will be in a head down position at this point. However, about 4% of the babies will be breech.

Do not panic! There are plenty of things that you can do to encourage the baby to turn, including special exercises.

Since her prenatal appointments are every week now, you might want to go with her to check in with her midwife or doctor


click here for prayer for the week

" I am around 48.6 cm by now and I weigh around 2859 Gms. I am officially full term now but can still benefit from extra days in the womb. I continue to practice breathing movements. If God gives me some more time for me to jump around your belly I would happily do it Mom. I tell you I love this first home of mine.


Are you listening Dad?

A pregnancy is considered a term pregnancy at this point and nothing will be done to stop labour in most circumstances. You should plan to take a tour of your birth facility if you have not previously.

If you are having a home birth try to invite everyone over for a quick run through of what you expect.

If you haven't helped her pack her bag for labour or get the house ready. Right now she could go into labour safely at any point.


click here for prayer for the week

" I am around 49.8 cm by now and I weigh around 3083 Gms. My intestines are accumulating lots of Meconium. Meconium takes on the role of being my first bowel movement – removing the waste that has accumulated. Circumference of head and abdomen are about the same size for me.

This week begins with the last days of my Mom‘s menstrual period. I am nowhere on the scene. But you know I am in the thoughts of God. Let me start my story from here. Let me dedicate this week to you and call it Mom‘s week. Are you happy now?

Soon we will be starting our journey together. Isn’t it amazing? I am in the thoughts of God and in your prayer list. I feel special cause you think about me before I am formed. And you know what Father God has big plans for me and He is creating me to fulfil His big plans!

Are you listening mom?

Hey mom you have no idea about me yet. I know that. But I know, both of you have dreamed of someone like me. And very soon I‘ll be there. Our nine – month love affair is about to begin. We have a long journey together. Even before we start let me warn you about my likes and dislikes. I like plenty of fruits and vegetables and I dislike smoking and alcohol. Tell this to everyone at home. I like simple exercises like going for long walks.
 click here for prayer for the week

It is the second week and I am still in the thoughts of God. You know what? To say in short God is preparing my room for my stay for the next 10 months. What a loving Dad He is! I know you and Dad are going to try to show love like God. We are all made in His image right?

Are you listening mom?

Your uterus is preparing a lush new bed of blood – rich tissue for me. One of the ripened eggs is getting ready to be released. Oops! I have started using medical terms. Hope they are not too difficult for you to understand. God has a plan for my life. He is sending me to you with a purpose. Yes Mom, my life is purpose driven. I am not an accident.
click here for prayer for the week

The real drama begins now. Dad sent many sperms inside mom, but only one intrepid one, the fastest of all swimmers that were vying for that single egg of mom‘s … yes only one could penetrate its outer layer and has fertilized it. God has enabled the first step of my journey. Whatever physical or mental shape I am going to acquire tomorrow will be credited to you both Dad and mom. But you Dad will wholly determine my sex. Mom has nothing to do with it.

Are you listening mom?

You are not going to be alone any more. You are on the way of becoming a responsible Mom! Yes Mom, I am going to bring about a lot of changes in you physically and emotionally. Are you ready for the journey? Nothing comes without a price. Yes I know you are going to sacrifice so much on our journey together. I love you Mom!
